newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Die Erste urges common stance on Creditanstalt bid.
newsitem.headline: Die Erste urges common stance on Creditanstalt bid.

text.p: Austria's Die Erste on Wednesday indicated it may leave an Austro-Italian consortium of bidders for privatisation candidate Creditanstalt in its present form unless the group agreed on a common stance by Friday.
"We want to continue being part of the consortium, but there are several other possible variations," a spokeswoman for the savings bank told Reuters.

The consortium, which includes insurer EA-Generali, Germany's Commerzbank and Banca Commerciale Italiana, is deeply split over Die Erste's proposal to set up a joint holding company with Creditanstalt.
The plan would give Die Erste, which is barely a third of the size of Creditanstalt, majority control of the holding.
Commerzbank reportedly has threatened to leave the consortium unless Die Erste backs down. Nobody at Commerzbank was immediately available for comment.

Austria's government on Tuesday turned up the heat on the consortium, saying their time was up unless the group came up with a final offer by midnight Friday, one week after the original deadline expired.
"This deadline is significantly more serious than last week's," Die Erste's spokeswoman said.
Finance Minister Viktor Klima said he would reopen the bidding process and invite offers from other interested parties if the consortium failed to comply with the deadline.

The group so far is the only known bidder for the government's 70 percent stake in Creditanstalt, which has been on the privatisation list for more than six years now. -- Vienna newsroom +431 53112 274
